page.title: 12 Banavie Quarry: 3
page.content: {Stone chips! What for?} The final produce, the stone chip is sold to a variety of customers for a variety of purposes. Most of the gravel is used in the construction of roads as road metal or in road repair. The other major use is in railway bottoming, and the size of chip produced depends on the job it is to be used for. Some gravel is used in tar making. The chips are first dried in a large oven and passed through bitumen. The quarry can produce up to 40 tons of tar every hour but is rarely required to do so. { {Living Dangerously} Finally, despite the regular blasting, the quarry cliff is home for countless sea-gulls and a family of ravens.
